com.mapbox.services.api.navigation.v5

Class RouteProgress

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.services.api.navigation.v5.RouteProgress

  • public class RouteProgress
extends Object
    The routeProgress class contains all progress information of user along the route, leg and step.

    You can use this together with MapboxNavigation to obtain this object from the AlertLevelChangeListener or the ProgressChangeListener. This object will be null from when the NavigationService starts till the first location change occurs. Therefore if you are using this to initialize a variable, it's reasonable to check if null beforehand. Since this object is mutable, the values given can change at anytime.

    This is an experimental API. Experimental APIs are quickly evolving and might change or be removed in minor versions.

    Since:
    2.0.0

        public LegStep getUpComingStep()
        Gets the next LegStep, if the route is on it's last step, we check if the route has an additional leg and if not, return the current index.
        Returns:
        A LegStep representing the next (or final) step in the route.
